title: Infinite Families of Gauge-Equivalent $R$-Matrices and Gradations of Quantized Affine Algebras
abstract: Associated with the fundamental representation of a quantum algebra such as $U_q(A_1)$ or $U_q(A_2)$, there exist infinitely many gauge-equivalent $R$-matrices with different spectral-parameter dependences. It is shown how these can be obtained by examining the infinitely many possible gradations of the corresponding quantum affine algebras, such as $U_q(A_1^{(1)})$ and $U_q(A_2^{(1)})$, and explicit formulae are obtained for those two cases. Spectral-dependent similarity (gauge) transformations relate the $R$-matrices in different gradations. Nevertheless, the choice of gradation can be physically significant, as is illustrated in the case of quantum affine Toda field theories.
